thread.title: Panther cross country team runs at Centerville
thread.title_full: Panther cross country team runs at Centerville

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Panther cross country team runs at Centerville
text:
Panther cross country team runs at Centerville Oct 07, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
CENTERVILLE — The seventh-ranked Mt. Pleasant boys’ cross country team won again on Tuesday night. Both the boys’ team and the girls’ team competed in Centerville, where the boys finished first and the girls placed seventh of 12 teams. 
Logan Murray, who currently sits at No. 2 in the 3A cross country rankings, finished first place overall with the time of 16:21. No. 26 Adam Bodenham gave Mt. Pleasant two top-five finish with a fifth-place finish of 17:24. 
Ryan Hutchinson placed 11th, in 18:00. Dalton Krum was the fourth Panther to finish in the top-15 with a 13th-place 18:08. Kyle Vanderham finished 22nd, in 18:27 and Jonathan Ita placed 24th, in 18:31. 
The Mt. Pleasant girls were at a disadvantage on Tuesday night. Top runner Taylor Murray was out of the race due to sickness. The rest of the team, however, stepped up in a big way, with improvements from each of the top five runners. 
Delaney McDowell led the MP girls with a 13-th place 22:23. Kelsey Notestein finished 27th, in 23:32, and Catherine Prough finished in a 40th-place 24:58, which was almost a two-minute improvement. 
Ally Davis and Megan Shumaker improved on their times with Davis finishing in 56th place, in 26:18; and Shumaker finishing 58th, in 26:31. Other varsity finishes for the girls were Megan Heonig (64th, 27:19) and Laurie Amos (73rd, 28:32). The girls also had three junior varsity runners; Emma Smith (20th, 27:29), Emily Larson (25th, 28:33) and Aggie Brooks (31st, 30:24). 
Mt. Pleasant will have a short rest before their next meet. The Panthers travel to North Linn on Saturday, Oct. 10, for a meet starting at 9 a.m.
